FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary



Facility:  County Line

Contact:  Mike Kersenbrock, Operations Manager

Phone:  (785) 462-6440



The management, and employees of County Line are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local sheriffs department, or other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the enviroment.



The primary activity at the facility is the storage of anhydrous ammonia to sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  The maximum quantity stored would be 170,391 pounds in the storage tanks and nurse tanks.



The facility is in compliance with the provisions of standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of anhydrous ammonia".  The OSHA standard is referenced in the RMP Regristration Form; see Section 8.3(b).



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility.



The facility has:



A. A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standar 29 CFR 1910.38.

B. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to -know information as required under SARA Title (EPCRA);

C. If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers.

     1. With-in 15 minutes of determining the amount of the release would be over 100 pounds, the Emergency Coordinator will notify: The National Emergency Response Center @ 800/424-8802.

     2. With-in 24 hours of determining the amount of releas would effect the environment, the Emergency Coordinator will no

tify; Kansas Bureau of Environmental Remediation @ 785/296-1679 or after normal business hours 785/296-0614 and The Kansas Department of Emergency Management@ 785/296-3176.



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditons of the facility.  There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implimentaion at this time.
